chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick Deante Butler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Patrick Deante Butler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Patrick Deante Butler was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: 10:41 AM Defendant Patrick Deante Butler in court.  Attorney Shanna Sanders in court for Patrick Deante Butler.  Attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads no contest to count 8. Court finds defendant guilty to count 8. Court orders 30 days jail full huber and Diversion Program call by October 17, 2022 and report by December 12, 2022 and costs due within 60 days. Sentence credit 0 days. Count 7 dismissed.

Activity: Arraignment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:00 PM Defendant Patrick Deante Butler in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Jason D Sanders by video.  David S. Olson and intern Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.

Activity: Preliminary Hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:24 AM Defendant Patrick Deante Butler in court in person in custody with attorney Shanna Sanders in person.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Alexander Limberg sworn in and testified by video. Witness identified Defendant. State moves for bind over, Defense objects without argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Defense argues for bond modification, State objects. Court grants bond modification to a $1,000 Signature Bond with the same conditions.  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. No contact with Co Defendants Luther Hughes or Steffon Carter.
Pro Se
Preliminary hearing on April 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:36 PM Defendant Patrick Deante Butler in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Jason D Sanders by video. Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Cash bond set of $500.00 with conditions: Court orders Level 4 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. No contact with Co Defendants Luther Hughes or Steffon Carter. Defendant has not contacted the public defenders office. Defendant wants to represent himself and request a preliminary hearing in Person scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 9 AM.
